result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Reynaldo Davila

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Reynaldo Davila in court.  Attorney Nicholas John Conrardy in court for Reynaldo Davila.  Attorney Patrick Anderson in court on behalf of Alexander James Geocaris for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a status conference. Defense has not received a report from his investigator and requests a status date. Court adjourns matter for a status. Case remains calendared in Branch 11.
Status conference scheduled for November 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Order to Fund Investigator, signed and filed.

Defendant Reynaldo Davila appeared by video.  Attorney Nicholas John Conrardy appeared by video for Reynaldo Davila.  Attorney Dennis Murphy in court on behalf of Alexander James Geocaris for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a scheduling conference. Defense requests a status date. Court adjourns matter for a status conference. Parties advised that all future court appearances will be in person. Case remains calendared in Branch 11.
Status conference scheduled for October 28, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Reynaldo Davila in court with attorney Nicholas John Conrardy.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  Reynaldo Davila appeared by telephone means with Attorney.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 11, Judge Swanson. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 11.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire & Waiver
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report - 08-16-2022

Defendant Reynaldo Davila in court.  Alex Geocaris appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Indigency hearing proceeded.  Based upon the defendant's statements, the court found the defendant eligible for appointment of counsel at county expense.  The court appointed Attorney Conrardy to represent the defendant; counsel to be paid at the rate of $100.00 per hour. The court ordered the defendant to repay Milwaukee County for attorney fees at the rate of $50.00 per month commencing at the close of the case.  Court finds it is the best interest that defendant that he reimburse the county up to $1200.00 in full. Failure to make timely payments according to the imposed payment schedule may result in a civil judgment, subject to tax intercept. Order Appointing Attorney at County Expense signed and filed.  Attorney Conrardy  in court and accepts appointment and requests additional time for review.  Matter adjourned to the preliminary hearing court.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Indigency hearing on July 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Reynaldo Davila in court, appear by video.  Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for preliminary hearing. Defendant appears without counsel.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28.   Court orders the case adjourned for CAUSE for an Indigency Hearing.   Per Chief Judge Directive 22-04 effective June 13, 2022, this calendar will be assigned to Reserve Judge John Franke, in Room 608 of the Courthouse.  Indigency hearing scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Supervision Report dated June 6, 2022 - received
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Reynaldo Davila in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Reynaldo Davila in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Reynaldo Davila appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28.  Per Chief Judge Directive 22-04 effective June 13, 2022, this calendar will be assigned to Reserve Judge John Franke, in Room 608 of the Courthouse. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.    DEFENDANT IS NOT INDIGENT.  
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
